title.narrative: Building the capacity of the Ombudsman

description.narrative: Improve the effective functioning of the Ombudsman Institution in line with European Union standards and establish a trusting relationship between the OI and the public at large.

The UNDP Turkey Office has applied to Sida for funding of 4,983,000 million SEK to carry out the project entitled "Support to Development of the Institutional Administration of the Ombudsman Institution in Turkey" during the period 2014-2016.
The intervention aims to improve the effective functioning of the Ombudsman Institution in line with European Union standards and establish a trusting relationship between the OI and the public at large by (1) improving the ability of the Ombudsman Institution for effective capacity development; (2) enhancing public awareness on the mandate and functioning of the OI; (3) increasing the OI's involvement in information sharing platforms with other Ombudsman Institutions in Europe. Those who benefit form the intervention in the end is expected to be everyone who comes into contact with public administration malpractice in Turkey. It is expected that an Ombudsman with a clear vision, mission and strategy, a clearly defined in-house division of labor and workflow, a secure place in international networks for Ombudsman institutions, and clear visibility among the people residing in Turkey will lead to a more independent Ombdusman in Turkey, making it a force in Turkey's political scene that encourages the use of a discourse of accountability and protection of human rights by being one of the most important reference points for the records of state institutions in this regard. Increased capacity, networking and visibility is expected to make the Ombudsman more active, especially in the sense of being used more as a trusted prevention and complaints mechanism regarding violation of human rights by those subject to such violations.
The intervention’s total budget is 4,983,000 SEK (750,000 USD), and Sida is the sole financier. The contribution is being coordinated by the Ombudsman's International Secretariat with an ongoing EU Twinning-projekt in support of the Ombudsman Institution.

UNDP Turkiet har ansökt till Sida om finansiering av 4.983.000 SEK för att genomföra projektet "Stöd till utvecklingen av den institutionella förvaltningen av Ombudsmannainstitutionen i Turkiet" under perioden 2014-2016.
Insatsen syftar till att förbättra den nyinrättade turkiska Ombudsmannainstitutionens funktionalitet och effektivitet, i linje med EU:s normer och skapa en förtroendefull relation mellan Ombudsmannainstitutionen och allmänheten genom att: 1) förbättra möjligheterna för Ombudsmannainstitutionen för effektiv kapacitetsutveckling; 2) öka allmänhetens medvetenhet om Ombudsmannainstitutionens mandat och funktion; 3) öka den turkiska Ombudsmannainstitutionens engagemang i plattformar och nätverk med andra Ombudsmannainstitutioner i Europa.
De som gynnas av insatsen i slutändan förväntas vara alla som drabbas av felbehandling inom den offentliga förvaltningen i Turkiet. En Ombudsmannainstitution med en tydlig vision, mission och strategi, en tydlig intern arbetsfördelning och arbetsflöden, en stabil plats i internationella nätverk för Ombudsmannainstitutioner och tydlig synlighet bland människor som bor i Turkiet, förväntas bidra till en mer oberoende Ombudsman. Denna kraft behövs i Turkiet, för att uppmuntra till användning av en diskurs om ansvarsskyldighet och skydd av de mänskliga rättigheterna, genom att vara en av de viktigaste oberoende referenspunkterna för att övervaka statliga institutioner i detta avseende. Ökad kapacitet, etablerade nätverk och en ökad synlighet förväntas göra Ombudsmannainstitutionen mer aktiv, särskilt i förebyggande syfte men även som mekanism för klagomål rörande brott mot de mänskliga rättigheterna begångna av staten mot den enskilda individen.
Insatsens totala budget är 4.983.000 SEK (750.000 USD) över tre år och Sida är ensam finansiär av insatsen. Insatsen sker parallellt med e EU-Twinningprojekt 2014-2015, som stödjer Ombudsmannainstitutionens institutionella struktur och personalresurshantering. Insatserna överlappar inte, utan samverkar och samordning sker av Ombudsmannainstitutionens internationella avdelning.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The main result of the projects were: Improved ability of the Ombudsman Institution for effective capacity development Enhanced public awareness on the mandate and functioning of Ombudsman Institution Increased involvement in information sharing platforms with other Ombudsman Institution in Europe The results of the project have improved the capacities of the staff members by adopting a Human Rights Based Approach in assessment and reporting of the complaints that have been submitted to the Ombudsman. Several of the policies and practices that have been recommended in the project have been adopted in the Strategic Plan 2017-2021 of the Ombudsman Institute thereby increasing the institutional capacity. A communication department was established in order to enhance public awareness on the mandate and functioning of Ombudsman Institution. Regional meetings were held in diverse regions of the country. The interest in the meetings were high and citizens, CSO representatives and muhtars (village headmen) attended the meetings. The meetings also hosted complaint desks were citizens could file complaints which in turn contributed to the increase of complaints made to the OI. Increasing awareness and effectiveness with public bodies was also attained in the regions the meetings took place as heads of public authorities in the region showed great interest to the meetings. There were 4028 applications to the OI in 2016 (October). This number reached 12507 with an increase of %211 for the same period. 1406 of these applications were resolved. The web site of the OI was also updated and e-applications were made possible. Complaints reached to 76.51% from the previous year. The website was visited by 650.000 by the end of 2017. Outreach via press and TV was 4109 for 2016. For 2017 this number reached 19492. The relationship with other international Ombudsman Institutes was developed and other examples have been studied by holding conferences and study tours. Meetings were held with Ombudsman Institutes from Spain, Belgium, Austria, Croatia, Bulgaria, Greece, South Korea and Azerbaijan. A gender action plan study was carried out and incorporated to activities and publications of the project. The Project team initiated a gender-specific work in particular for the training component. Though not an activity in this project a workshop was held with 37 Women CSOs.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
